page.title: International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination

revisions.rev:
The '''International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination''' (ICERD) is a [[United Nations]] [[Treaty|convention]] adopted and opened for signature and ratification by [[United Nations General Assembly]] [[United Nations General Assembly Resolution|resolution]] 2106 (XX) [[December 21]], [[1965]], and which entered into force [[January 4]], [[1969]]. As of November 2006, it has been ratified by 173 nations and a further five have signed it.
The Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination oversees the implementation of the Convention. It is one of seven UN-linked [[human rights treaty bodies]].
==External links== *[http://www.ohchr.org/english/law/cerd.htm Text of the Convention] on the site of the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights *[http://www.ohchr.org/english/bodies/cerd/ Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination]
